commit.title: Support multiple sources in asset tag helpers
upgrade ruby while we're at it
the same URL is repeated twice in the gemspec
Add nonced versions of Rails link/include tags
Update example to use multiple config values
Update Expect-CT to use separator in spec
Bump to 5.0.0 and update docs with upgrade guide
Add last missing `SecureHeaders` namespace fix for `OPT_OUT`
Remove `includeSubdomains` in the example that's getting copy/pasted
Remove examples from README that are never meant to be copy/pasted
addressed the comments from the review
Changes to the documentation  to make it more explicit that provided configuration should only be used as a reference
Distinguish between source lists directives and non-source list directives (#354)
add note about script-src being required and how to opt out
add long comment about ensuring this specific test remains non-https
don't try to modify an opt-out config for cookies
make note about overriding script-src requirement clearer
allow opting out of script-src requirement
fix broken test due to changed defaults
Update docs to reflect new defaults
Updates documentation detailing the new cookie defaults
Adds secure and httponly to cookies by default
Default samesite: true to mean SameSite=Lax instead of Strict
[skip ci] add docs about removed #secure_cookies API
raise errors when child/frame-src values don't match
more notes around CSP deprecated changes
make deprecations around setting CSP out of order turn into exceptions
Add note about upcoming 4.x line in readme
Update tests to reflect new defaults/required settings
Simplify the directives setup by removing the "draft" ones
use default csp that is more strict but shouldn't break things terribly
Bump Ruby version to 2.4.1 and test versions of 2.3 and 2.4
Pins dependency version of useragent because secure_headers actually requires this version for the test suite to pass
Update Clear-Site-Data to use the current spec format.
remove rspec block notation from Rakefile
split out rspec and rubocop in CI
update contribution guidelines to mention warnings
fix warnings from running in verbose mode
Updated a few places where wrong wordage was being used for where and how to configure hashes
prevent loss of frame_src/child_src when using append_content_security_policy_directives
Add Ruby 2.3 and 2.4 to test matrix.
Use full version for Ruby 2.3 on travis, otherwise it fails
Avoid creating extra arrays when building the headers hash
Simplify the modified check on the config to avoid metaprogramming
Perform lop using `each_key` instead of creating intermediate array
Extract logic to write attribute to prevent double checking for the attribute being valid
Loop a single time over the hash to set configs
Cache instance variable name to prevent creating the same string 3 times
Speed up `to_h` on dynamic config by performing a single loop through attrs
Cache the config attributes to prevent creating multiple objects at runtime
Include Ruby 2.3 in the test matrix
Remove `preload` from the default HSTS configuration in the README.
add functionality to validate/set the header via the config
different exception for invalid utf8 in 1.9.3
make links to docs anchored at /docs
add more to the main readme, make the sinatra config a standalone file
link the README as the docs index file
move content of configuration.md into main README

Attempt at breaking up the documentation
make the nonce support helper method public
Remove "use" section because everyone knows how to do this and would use bundler anyways.
restrict term-ansicolor so it works on 1.9
bump for prerelease w/ two csp headers
handle the case where nonces weren't populated for default csp configs using the nonce helpers
infer default policies when incomplete CSP configuration is supplied.
add guard ensuring people aren't setting csp_report_only with report_only: false
ensure that the deprecated way of using the report_only header still works :)
don't modify the original config object, removing the need to dup it
inline method so we're not creating UserAgent objects everywhere
remove unnecessary special handling of CSP/CSPRO now that they are separate classes
get rid of even more != OPT_OUT
use #opt_out? helper in another location again
update docs to show csp/cspro config
add tests for inferring which policy to modify
ensure that config objects are only dup'd when necessary
don't specify the target since that's not the point of the test
add tests for overriding with two headers
specs for the configuration class now pass
initial work for making csp config an actual class
bump to 3.4.0 and include child/frame-src handling
hook include of helper to loading of ActionView

lock the json gem to a 1.9.3-friendly version
remove reference to frame-src in README

add tests showing each directives specific value. also demonstrats copying child-src to frame-src.

update x-frame-options link to RFC [ci skip]
Alternative fix for already initialized constant

add a test for referencing an undefined override
add a top-level test for validation cookie configuration
add more tests around unknown hash behavior
clarify, document, and test behavior when encountering unknown hashes
DRY up the samesite only/except usage validations
break up cookie validations into separate methods
extract cookies configuration validation to separate class
make location of hash file configurable via ENV
switch from regex matchers to string equality matchers
store parsed cookie attributes as symbols
move cookie spec to headers directory
parse the cookie to determine existing flags
update documentation for SameSite cookie configurations

because hashes are already an array

add test statements showing env is void of a config
no need to namespace the Configuration class
use let construct instead of an ivar for the request object

use deep_copy in CombinePolicies just in case
to_s was hiding a potential bug
update header cache directly rather than updating config values (except CSP)
ensure that headers other than xfo/csp can bypassed for a given request (and the cache is updated)
mark cached_headers setter method as protected to avoid a send call
move cache management code for xframeoptions inside Configuration class. make cached_headers an attr_reader again
there is no reason to deep dup config values since we can assume the configs we are modifying are dups of the originals
handle dup'ing the secure_cookies config value
merge! call can be replaced with merge
cached_headers will always contain the desired values
